newsitem.title: UK: Chemical fire causes Thames water concern.
newsitem.headline: Chemical fire causes Thames water concern.

text.p: A fire in a chemical factory at Slough, west of London, has caused concern about possible pollution of the river Thames, environmental officials said on Thursday.

Three water companies that abstract water from the Thames -- Thames Water Plc, Three Valleys Water and the North Surrey Water Company -- were advised of the incident. A watercourse that flows into the Thames was polluted and a barrier put across it.

The factory, owned by Sun Chemicals, is understood to have contained 100 tonnes of ink, 90 tonnes of varnish and 30 tonnes of solvent, the Environment Agency watchdog said in a statement. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7950
